The abstract noun "truth" can be translated as an adjective. Alternate translation: "what is true ... no lie comes from what is true" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: the truth ... no lie is from the truth

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract noun "commandment" can be stated as "command." Alternate translation: "This is what God commands us to do: Believe ... just as he commanded us to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: This is his commandment: that we should believe ... just as he gave us this commandment

contextId.occurrenceNote: The noun "love" can be translated as a verb. This phrase can be made active. Alternate translation: "God showed that he loves us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἐφανερώθη ἡ ἀγάπη τοῦ Θεοῦ ἐν ἡμῖν
contextId.glQuote: the love of God was revealed among us

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "propitiation" refers to Jesus' death on the cross appeasing God's wrath against sin. The word can be translated with a verbal phrase. Alternate translation: "he sent his Son to be the sacrifice that appeased his wrath against our sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: he sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "life" throughout this letter refers to more than physical life. Here "life" refers to being alive spiritually. See how you translated this in [1 John 1:1](../01/01.md). (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "confidence" can be stated as "confident." Alternate translation: "we are confident in God's presence because we know that" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: αὕτη ἐστὶν ἡ παρρησία ... ἔχομεν πρὸς αὐτόν: ὅτι
contextId.glQuote: this is the confidence we have before him, that
